intro: Heptapleurum chandrasekharanii, commonly known as the Chandrasekharanii shrub, is a species of flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a evergreen shrub characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. It belongs to the family Pentaphylacaceae and is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
